definitions.definition: used to refer to somebody/something that has already been mentioned or is easily understood

examples.text: There were three questions. The first two were relatively easy but the third one was hard.
There was an accident here yesterday. A car hit a tree and the driver was killed.
The heat was getting to be too much for me.
The nights are getting longer.

definitions.definition: used to refer to somebody/something that is the only, normal or obvious one of their kind

examples.text: the Mona Lisa
the Nile
the Queen
What's the matter?
The phone rang.
I patted her on the back.
How's the *(= your)* baby?

definitions.definition: used when explaining which person or thing you mean

examples.text: the house at the end of the street
The people I met there were very friendly.
It was the best day of my life.
You're the third person to ask me that.
Friday the thirteenth
Alexander the Great

definitions.definition: used to refer to a thing in general rather than a particular example

examples.text: He taught himself to play the violin.
The dolphin is an intelligent animal.
They placed the African elephant on their endangered list.
I heard it on the radio.
I'm usually out during the day.

definitions.definition: used with adjectives to refer to a thing or a group of people described by the adjective

examples.text: With him, you should always expect the unexpected.
the unemployed
the French

definitions.definition: used before the plural of somebody’s last name to refer to a whole family or a married couple

examples.text: Don't forget to invite the Jordans.

definitions.definition: used with a unit of measurement to mean ‘every’

examples.text: My car does forty miles to the gallon.
You get paid by the hour.

definitions.definition: enough of something for a particular purpose

examples.text: I wanted it but I didn't have the money.

definitions.definition: used with a unit of time to mean ‘the present’

examples.text: Why not have the dish of the day?
She's flavour of the month with him.

definitions.definition: used, stressing the, to show that the person or thing referred to is famous or important

examples.text: Sheryl Crow? Not the Sheryl Crow?
At that time London was the place to be.

definitions.definition: used to show that two things change to the same degree

examples.text: The more she thought about it, the more depressed she became.
The less said about the whole thing, the happier I'll be.

wordOrigin: Old English se, sēo, thæt, ultimately superseded by forms from Northumbrian and North Mercian thē, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch de, dat, and German der, die, das.
